1.text: Wash and dry the hoodie on the highest heat setting to pre-shrink it.

2.text: Slide a piece of cardboard inside the hoodie to keep it flat.

3.text: Cover a flat work surface with a drop cloth and lay the hoodie on top.

4.text: Put coin-sized amounts of fabric paint on an artist’s palette.

5.text: Draw your design on the hoodie with chalk to use as a guide.

6.text: Use short strokes to apply the paint directly on your hoodie.

7.text: Dab round brushes straight down if you want to freehand polka dots.

8.text: Draw with fabric paint markers if you want to add detailed lines.

9.text: Flick diluted paint on your hoodie if you want to make a splatter pattern.

10.text: Rinse your brushes in clean water when you change colors or finish painting.

12.text: Cut along the outline of the stencil with a craft knife.

13.text: Tape the stencil to the hoodie with masking tape.

14.text: Put fabric paint on your palette.

15.text: Dab the sponge vertically to apply the paint.

16.text: Remove the stencil as soon as you’re done painting.

17.text: Get fabric spray paint in the colors you want to use for your hoodie.

18.text: Work in a well-ventilated area to prevent fume build-up.

19.text: Block off any areas you don’t want to spray with cardboard.

20.text: Apply the spray paint in short bursts to prevent overspray.

21.text: Make horizontal stripes with different colors if you want an ombre pattern.

22.text: Wait 24 hours for the paint to dry completely.

23.text: Hold a hot iron 2 in (5.1 cm) over the design to heat-set the paint.

24.text: Wash your hoodie inside-out on the gentle cycle 5 days after painting it.

25.text: Hang the hoodie up to dry to prevent cracking.
